intro: Selago goetzei subsp. goetzei, commonly known as the narrowleaf selago, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are often pink or white, and it produces a capsule fruit containing numerous tiny seeds. This subspecies is notable for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions and its ornamental value in xeriscaping.
